subject: Database of Immovable Assets (other than Highways) and Surplus Land held with NHAI.
text: HRdq <rtv WTTHTfsifearxut FH19 Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (s75 4ar7 3){ToTHTf 1AT74) G7 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) Ji-5 & 6, #azr-10 , aRTT ,_ 1 ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI/ Policy Guidelines/Land Acquisition/ 2019 No. 7.1.58/2019 dated the Int September , 2019 [Decision taken on File No. NHAI/LA/immovable Assets/2019] Sub: Database of Immovable Assets (other than Highways) and Surplus Land held with NHAI. For the purpose of construction development of National highways, Land is acquired under the provisions contained in Section 3 of the National Highways Act, 1956. Further , land has also been transferred to NHAI by State Govt., and other Govt. organisations. 2 _ There are instances where land acquired/purchased /transferred is found to be surplus due to various reasons. Surplus iand for the purpose of present circular is the land which does not part of ROW of existing highway or ongoing project: The reason for such surplus land may be due to subsequent change in alignment, land transferred on entrustment to NHAI of any existing NH by Ministry or conversion from SH to NH; excess acquisition of land, acquired for a specific purpose but not utilized or ~lying unutilized due to any other reason for more than two years. In some cases, official buildings have also constructed in such surplus lands. 3_ It has been found that there is no exclusive policy for use of such immovable asset/surplus land: Chairman has desired that a database of all such assets/surplus land be compiled before a policy for their use is formulated. 4_ With a view to facilitate compilation /updation of data of all immovable assets (other than highways) /surplus land; a web based application namely 'Surplus Land Information Systern has been developed by IT Div . and shall be available at website of NHAI within two days of issue of this circular. Complete software input screen, dashboards and reports are enclosed alongwith for reference. 5_ Salient features of the application 'Surplus Land information System are as follows: (a) PIUs Dashboard-PIUs have to enter the surplus land details in the software application and upload notifications, cadastral maps and photographs. (b) NHAI-HQ Dashboard Authorized users at HQ can view / download all surplus land details (entered by PIUs). (c) NHAI-HQ user can generate reports, take outs, create PDF as per their requirement: H1 RTrI NHAL form been print
